title: Pressure mounts in UK to take action over blacklisted Chinese CCTV firm
text:
Demands are mounting for an official inquiry into NHS and council contracts with a Chinese CCTV firm blacklisted for allegedly spying on persecuted Chinese Muslims.

Camera maker Hikvision has been placed on a list of prohibited firms in America for installing cameras in Xinjiang, where China's Communist Party is engaged in mass surveillance of Uighur Muslims. Many are held in political prisons dubbed "re-education centres".

The firm also has 1.3m cameras in the UK - including thousands at airports, NHS Trusts and local councils.
